column1: CVE-2018-20843 expat 2.2.5-r0- LOW "In libexpat in Expat before 2.2.7
column2: XML input including XML names that contain a large number of colons could make the XML parser consume a high amount of RAM and CPU resources while processing (enough to be usable for denial-of-service attacks)."

the C implementation of AES is vulnerable to a flush-and-reload side-channel attack because physical addresses are available to other processes. (The C implementation is used on platforms where an assembly-language implementation is unavailable.)"

column1: CVE-2019-14697 musl 1.1.19-r10- LOW "musl libc through 1.1.23 has an x87 floating-point stack adjustment imbalance
column2: related to the math/i386/ directory. In some cases
column3: use of this library could introduce out-of-bounds writes that are not present in an application's source code."
